body: 0.3 is a pretty old release at this point. It is possible your problem has already been fixed in git. If you got some free time, could you try building the git version and see if you are still having troubles?

Can't seem to build on Windows 7:

The build is a separate issue, but got it to build an exe. Before I was using standard windows shell, which only generated a .o file. When trying with msys it made a .exe.

Are you expecting something to be in the toolchain (make, gcc, etc.) that would only be present in msys and not the standard windows command prompt?
Yes, gcc. we currently use it as the linker driver. Likely to move to a more general model eventually (and hopefully work with microsoft's link.exe)
